title: Vladimir is not a vampire.
body:
I am a Vlad main and a lore enthusiast. Since he's been slightly elevated into the spotlight thanks to his name coming up in the Mid-Year Mage Rework post, I felt it necessary to highlight this.

On a personal level, it reeeaaaally bothers me that people keep saying over and over that Vladimir is a vampire, or defined as being a vampire, or whatever variation on that phrasing exists.

He's a blood mage with vampire aesthetics sure, but no where is it ever stated that Vladimir's a vampire. There's no mention to an aversion to sunlight, there's nothing suggesting he drinks blood, and there's nothing implying that he's undead in any way.

He just really, really likes blood. That's it.

Edit: Yes, he has a tremendous amount of vampire-related thematics and skins, and there's no reason he _shouldnt_ be a vampire, just so happens that he isnt for whatever reason. I'm not opposed to him being one, it's just that he's not, and I'm the type of person who likes the distinction to be clear.

I think they'll keep his mage-tank qualities. If they don't they'll side towards the mage-half of him I reckon since y'know, this is the _Mage _ Update.

A fair amount of players (myself included) have expressed possible interest in a resource bar (a la Aatrox's bloodwell, but more...refined). I'm more attached to Vlad having free or pseudo free (something like a easy-to-hit skillshot that costs hp to use but refunds the cost completely if it lands) than having his Q, since Riot said that's specifically what they dislike about him.

I think I might be okay with that, but it would have to do either significantly more damage early on, or buff his other abilities a great deal. After all, he's not OP or UP right now, and if they throw in a skill shot, it ought to be more powerful than a point and click. The thing that bothers me most about that though is that he's a blood mage. He should have at least one ability that drains his enemies' blood, and that's not something you aim for exactly, ya know? It's not shooting a blast of magic at someone; it's willing their blood to be ripped from their arteries and veins and taking it for yourself.

That isn't a skillshot thing, at least in my opinion.

I understand what you're getting at though. And then a resource bar might be interesting, but I hope they keep elements of his current passive. It's really nice to be able to build straight AP (but mostly AP items with some defensive stats, such as Zhonya's, Abyssal, Liandry's, Rylai's, and WotA) and still get relatively tanky. If they don't keep that, they'll have to either put innate tankiness into his stats, or turn him into a long-ranged mage, or make him into a burst mage. And not a single one of the latter two options make much sense imo.

I like Vlad, but I see why he needs some work. Mainly because spellvamp is being held back as long as he exists in his current form. I see why you feel that draining blood just couldn't work as a skill-shot so I worked out a way that I believe is an acceptable alternative to you and serves my own ends of removing Vlad's current unfitting ultimate to make way for a new one. Vlad could have a slow-moving skill-shot (think slightly faster than Illaoi's E) that tethers him to the first target hit and slowly drains life from them. While so affected by this tether, that target takes somewhat more damage from Vlad's abilities and Vlad heals more from damaging them. This way we find that a blood-draining skillshot feels good and we offset his thematically confusing ultimate onto his transfuse which makes room for a new more single-target oriented tanky Vlad rather than the current "Somehow my blood makes everyone take 8% more damage" Vlad.

What I'm saying is I hate his current ultimate, because it feels boring and doesn't match with the fantasy of being the big bad Blood-mage that I envision Vlad to be.
